title: Bug 3666 Code Completion Hungry code assist (1GDRYW5)
description: Bug 3666 Code Completion Hungry code assist (1GDRYW5) jkca (5/15/2001 11:04:56 AM) jresdk 106 Under certain circumstances code assist eats too much code. Consider the enclosed class. As a programmer, I must add a parameter to the baz call in bar to make the program correct. Steps: 1. UI can decide whether it wants to use the code assist end position (until the end of current identifier) or the cursor location it used to start with, so as to control the amount of source to replace. Removing code assist option.
OB: Under certain circumstances, the code assist eats too much code.
EB: The code assist should not eat too much code and should provide assistance only for the relevant code.
SR: To reproduce the issue: 1. Change the baz call to baz(x.x.foo()) 2. Place the cursor after the first "x." 3. Press Ctrl+Space to bring up code assist. 4. Type "f" to filter the list. 5. Select "foo()".
